intro: Hieracium neyranum subsp. grausonicum, commonly known as the Neurynsch mountain hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, thriving in cool and sunny environments. It has slender, hairy stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
